answers.answer: Hi there.These symptoms are somewhat nonspecific and can be caused by several disease entities.The light headedness and imbalance can be caused by metabolic and cardiovascular problems such as diabetes or hypertension respectively.  This can also be caused by primary ear problems causing vertigo.  Cerebellar problems such as cerebellar strokes can also cause these symptoms.Neurologic problems that can be due to nutritional deficiencies (like vitamin B) can explain some of the tingling in the hands and feet.Sometimes these can be non-specific symptoms of a developing demyelinating conditions such as multiple sclerosis.As there can be a lot of possibilities, it is best to have yourself evaluated by your doctor.  Regards.

question: what could be some of the causes of tingling hands and feet and also a sense of imbalance/light headedness?
title: tingling hands and feet and sense of imbalance
